lines.text: [MUSIC]
Last time on Trebuchet Village, we were introduced to Trebuchet Village,
a village that existed long ago on planet Ebound.
And the kingdom of the terrifier, a kingdom filled with orcs, goblins,
trolls, and other nasty beasts that won a great war against the forces of good. Chief among
these beasts were the Nards, terrifying furry beasts with yellow eyes, a terrible fanged
underbite, six legs with talons on the ends of them, two arms and a penis tail that blossoms
when they turn 18 and whispers dark thoughts in their ears. We also met our three heroes,
Dogen the Dirt Goblin, Paladin and Dirt Enthusiast, Patrick Jodar, Master Shoplifter and nephew
of a famous uncle, Evil Stevel, a vile cleric with a hip-hop edge. When they began their
day, our heroes were just simple sales associates at ye olde Sullivan's General Store who moonlight
as adventurers. They dispatched some unruly teenage grimlocks threatening their place
of work, and then split off afterwards to perform their adventuring duties, which took them
all to Mount Honestoodle, where the Crown Prince of the Terrifier Kingdom, the Nard Prince
Jumanji, was celebrating his fifth birthday. For Nards, turning five years old is an important
event, because the young Nards will perform their first kill in front of their community,
and in this case, in front of much of the kingdom's important monsters and beasts.
Mount Honestoodle is a mountain sacred to the Nards, prominently located near Trebuchet
village just outside the royal family's home of Claw Castle.
There, Dogen the Dirt Goblin was tasked with protecting the boy during this celebration
by a group of paladins hired by King Nardwaur, the prince's father.
Patric Yodar was meant to perform the greatest of heists by kidnapping the young prince in
order to further the ends of the Sticky Fingers Guild.
And Evil Steva was sent by the Pleasure Men, a cult who worship Discharge, the disciple
of the Terrifier, to destroy the boy and many prominent leaders of the Terrifier Kingdom.
The ceremony itself was a controversial affair with King Nardwar amending the ceremony.
Instead of any of these things happening however, our heroes, along with the entirety of those
in the ceremony, were launched at possibly high by some unknown force, possibly volcanic,
bursting forth from the mountain itself.
Dogen, Patric, Evil, Sullivan, and the Prince awoke to find themselves in Whippet Woods,
a dangerous and bizarre woodlands, nearly two weeks by carriage from their home.
As they began to acclimate to their situation, Patric Yodar grabbed a sword, sticking out
of a cheeky stone that begged for its sword to be pulled. This act awoke one of the many
strange beasts that threaten our heroes in these woods. So far from Trebuchet Village
and a battle ensues. How did our heroes survive? How did they land intact with a child prince
and their frazzled supervisor, Sullivan? Is it the work of the gods or the natural tempur-pedic
cushion that lines the forest floor.
Who's to say?
But what is known is that there is a lost prince and perhaps a reward for his
return would be greater than any reward offered for his abduction or destruction.
